rounds.event: The European Exchange Rate Mechanism freezes the values of the legacy currencies in the Eurozone, and establishes the value of the euro currency.
deaths: Ted Glossop, Australian rugby league player and coach

rounds.event: President Harry S. Truman officially proclaims the end of hostilities in World War II.

rounds.event: A fire breaks out at the Downtown Address Hotel in Downtown Dubai, United Arab Emirates, located near the Burj Khalifa, two hours before the fireworks display is due to commence. Sixteen injuries were reported; one had a heart attack, another suffered a major injury, and fourteen others with minor injuries.
deaths: Natalie Cole, American singer-songwriter and actress
Wayne Rogers, American actor and investor

rounds.event: Cold War: The Marshall Plan expires after distributing more than US$13.3 billion in foreign aid to rebuild Western Europe.
births: Tom Hamilton, American bass player and songwriter
deaths: Murtaza Hasan Chandpuri, Indian Muslim scholar

rounds.event: Indian Airlines Flight 814 hijacking ends after seven days with the release of 190 survivors at Kandahar Airport, Afghanistan.
births: Hunter Schafer, American actress, model, and activist
deaths: Elliot Richardson, American lawyer and politician, 69th United States Attorney General
Abul Hasan Ali Nadwi, Indian Muslim scholar and author
